subclassfeature3.1.name: Telekinetic Hand
subclassfeature3.1.description: I learn the Mage Hand cantrip, can cast it without components, and can make it invisible

mage hand.description: Create invisible spectral hand for simple tasks or carry up to 10 lb; 1 a to control; can't have multiples
mage hand.changes: My Telekinetic Hand class feature allows me to cast Mage Hand without components and I can make the spectral hand invisible.

subclassfeature7.name: Strength of Mind
subclassfeature7.description:
As a bonus action, I can have a creature I can see within 20 ft make a Strength save
   It takes 2d6 + Int mod psychic damage & moves 15 ft away or towards me (my choice)
   If its save succeeds, it takes half damage and isn't moved; DC 8 + Prof Bonus + Int mod

subclassfeature10.name: Telekinetic Bulwark
subclassfeature10.description:
When I take the Attack action, I can forgo one of the attacks to project psionic power
   Myself and my allies within 10 ft of me gain half cover and adv. on Strength saves
   This 10-ft radius bastion around me lasts for 1 minute or until I'm incapacitated
   I regain the usage of this feature after I use my second wind feature

subclassfeature15.name: Agonizing Strikes
subclassfeature15.description:
When I hit a creature with a weapon attack, I can deal an extra +2d10 psychic damage
   The target also has to make a Constitution save (DC 8 + my Prof Bonus + my Int mod)
   If it fails, it falls prone and has disadv. on its next ability check until my next turn starts

subclassfeature18.name: Psychic Dreadnaught
subclassfeature18.description:
As a reaction when I take damage, I can give myself the following benefits for 1 minute:
    • At the start of each of my turns, I regain 10 hit points
    • My walking speed increases by +10 ft
    • If I'm prone, I can stand up by spending 5 ft of movement
   These benefits also end when I'm incapacitated

subclassfeature3.name: Psychic Blade
subclassfeature3.description:
As a bonus action, I can create a magical blade from one or both of my hands
   Disappear if I'm incapacitated, leave my hand (not thrown), or I dismiss it (no action)

weaponOptions.name: Soulknife's Psychic Blade
weaponOptions.description: Finesse, light, thrown

subclassfeature3.1.name: Psionic Enhancement
subclassfeature3.1.description:
When I finish a long rest, I can choose one of these benefits until my next long rest:
    • Talk telepathically with those I can see in 30 ft; Can respond if they know a language
    • Increase my walking speed by 5 ft
    • Increase my maximum and current HP with my Intelligence modifier plus rogue level

subclassfeature9.name: Terrifying Blade
subclassfeature9.description:
When I damage a creature with my psychic blade, it must make a Wisdom saving throw
   If it fails, it is frightened of me until my the start of my next turn
   If it succeeds, it is immune to this for 24 hours; DC 8 + my Prof Bonus + my Int mod

subclassfeature13.name: Psychic Veil
subclassfeature13.description:
As an action, I can become invisible along with everything I'm wearing or carrying
   This ends after 10 minutes, if I make an attack, or if I force a creature to make a save

subclassfeature17.name: Rend Mind
subclassfeature17.description:
As an action, I can deal 12d6 psychic damage to a creature I can see within 30 ft
   It also makes an Int save or is stunned until my next turn starts; Half damage on success
   It has disadv. on the save if I'm hidden from it; DC 10 + my Prof Bonus + my Int mod
   I must have a psychic blade manifested to do so and one vanishes when I use this feature

subclassfeature2.name: Psionic Focus
subclassfeature2.description:
I learn to channel psionic energy through an object special to me, my psionic focus
   It allows me to reroll a roll of 1 on any psychic or force damage die for my wizard spells
   I can use this as my spellcasting focus; If lost, I can recreate it by meditating for 1 hour

subclassfeature2.1.name: Psionic Devotion
subclassfeature2.1.description:
I learn one cantrip: Friends, Mage Hand, or Message; Use "Choose Feature" button above
   While my psionic focus is on me, I can cast it as a bonus action without components

friends.name: Psionic Devotion: Friends
friends.description:
I learn the Friends cantrip and while my psionic focus in on me, I am better at casting it
   I can cast it as a bonus action without components and the target doesn't become hostile
Adv. on Cha checks vs. 1 crea currently not hostile; when spell ends, crea realizes I used magic
friends.changes: While my psionic focus is on my person, I can cast Friends as a bonus action without requiring any components and when the spell ends, the target doesn't become hostile to me.

mage hand.name: Psionic Devotion: Mage Hand
mage hand.description:
I learn Mage Hand and while my psionic focus in on me, I am better at casting it
   I can then cast it as a bonus action without components and can make the hand invisible
   Also, I can control the hand as a bonus action instead of an action
Create invisible hand for simple tasks or carry up to 10 lb; 1 bns action to control; can't have multiples
mage hand.changes: While my psionic focus is on my person, I can cast Mage Hand as a bonus action without requiring any components, can make the hand invisible, and controlling the hand is a bonus action for me.

message.name: Psionic Devotion: Message
message.description:
I learn the Message cantrip and while my psionic focus in on me, I'm better at casting it
   I can then cast it as a bonus action without components
   Also, I don't need to point at the target or whisper the message out loud
1 crea hears message I think; can reply with a whisper; nobody can overhear; needs no straight line
message.changes: While my psionic focus is on my person, I can cast Message as a bonus action without requiring any components, don't need to point toward the target, and I don't need to whisper my message out loud.

subclassfeature6.name: Thought Form
subclassfeature6.description:
As a bonus action, I can use my psionic focus to transform my body into luminous energy
   I chose the shape (my size); It sheds 5-ft radius dim light; My equipment melds into it
   My psionic focus hovers within the energy; In this form, I have the following benefits:
    • Spells I cast require no verbal, somatic, or material components without a gold cost
    • I have resistance to psychic and nonmagical bludgeoning/piercing/slashing damage
   This lasts for 10 minutes or until I'm incapacitated, die, or use a bonus action to end it

subclassfeature10.name: Mental Discipline
subclassfeature10.description:
I learn one spell: Dominate Person, Scrying, or Telekinesis; Use "Choose Feature" button
   I can cast the spell without a spell slot once per long rest (and normally with a spell slot)

dominate person.name: Mental Discipline: Dominate Person
dominate person.description:
I add Dominate Person to my spellbook and can cast it without requiring components
   Once per long rest, I can cast it without using a spell slot; I can also prepare it as normal

dominate person.changes: I can cast Dominate Person without requiring any components. Once per long rest, I can cast it without using a spell slot. I can also cast it by using spell slots as normal.

scrying.name: Mental Discipline: Scrying
scrying.description:
I add Scrying to my spellbook and can cast it without requiring components
   Once per long rest, I can cast it without using a spell slot; I can also prepare it as normal

scrying.changes: I can cast Scrying without requiring any components. Once per long rest, I can cast it without using a spell slot. I can also cast it by using spell slots as normal.

telekinesis.name: Mental Discipline: Telekinesis
telekinesis.description:
I add Telekinesis to my spellbook and can cast it without requiring components
   Once per long rest, I can cast it without using a spell slot; I can also prepare it as normal

telekinesis.changes: I can cast Telekinesis without requiring any components. Once per long rest, I can cast it without using a spell slot. I can also cast it by using spell slots as normal.

subclassfeature10.1.name: Empowered Psionics
subclassfeature10.1.description: I add my Int modifier to one target of my wizard spells that do psychic or force damage

spellAdd.body: function(e,a,t){if(-1!=t.indexOf("wizard"))return genericSpellDmgEdit(e,a,"force|psychic","Int",!0)}

spellAdd: When I deal psychic or force damage with a wizard spell, I can add my Intelligence modifier to the damage against one of the spell's targets.

subclassfeature14.name: Thought Travel
subclassfeature14.description:
While in my thought form, I gain a fly speed equal to my walking speed and I can hover
   I can then also move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain
   I take 1d10 force damage if I end my turn inside an object
   If I end my thought form while inside an object, I'm shunted to the nearest empty space
   I then take 1d10 force damage for every 5 ft traveled

subclassfeature3.name: Form of the Beast
subclassfeature3.description:
When I enter my rage, I can transform to gain a bite, tail, or claws attack for that rage
   The bite attack allows me to regain my Con mod in HP on a hit once on my turn
   The claws attack allows me to make one extra attack when I use it in my Attack action

weaponOptions.name: Bestial Bite
weaponOptions.description: Only in rage; On a hit once on my turn, regain Con mod in HP

weaponOptions.name: Bestial Claws
weaponOptions.description: Only in rage; Extra attack if used as part of Attack action

weaponOptions.name: Bestial Tail
weaponOptions.description: Reach; Only in rage

subclassfeature6.name: Bestial Soul
subclassfeature6.description:
When I finish a short rest, I can choose one of the following benefits until my next rest:
    • Swimming speed equal to my walking speed and I can breathe underwater
    • Climb speed (same as walking) and no check to climb difficult surfaces or upside down
    • Once per turn when I jump, I can extend it by the result of an Athletics check in feet

atkAdd: The natural melee weapon that I gain from Form of the Beast count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

subclassfeature10.name: Infectious Fury
subclassfeature10.description:
In rage, when I hit a creature with my natural weapon, I can have it make a Wis save
   If it fails (DC 8 + my Prof Bonus + my Con mod) it suffers one effect of my choice:
    • It uses its reaction to make a melee attack against one creature I can see of my choice
    • It takes 2d12 psychic damage

subclassfeature14.name: Call the Hunt
subclassfeature14.description:
When I enter rage, I can choose my Con mod of willing creatures I can see within 30 ft
   The targets gain the Reckless Attack feature and I have adv. on saves vs. being frightened
   I also gain 5 temporary hit points per creature that accepts this benefit

subclassfeature3.name: Implements of Mercy
subclassfeature3.description:
I gain proficiency with the herbalism and poisoner's kit, and either Insight or Medicine
   Use the "Choose Feature" button above to select the skill proficiency, Insight or Medicine

proficiency with insight.name: Implements of Mercy - Insight
proficiency with insight.description: I gain proficiency in the Insight skill and with the herbalism kit and the poisoner's kit

proficiency with medicine.name: Implements of Mercy - Medicine
proficiency with medicine.description: I gain proficiency in the Medicine skill and with the herbalism kit and the poisoner's kit

hands of healing.name: Hands of Healing
description:
As an action, I can spend 1 ki point to touch a creature and restore a number of its HP
   When I use Flurry of Blows, I can do this instead of one unarmed strike (no extra ki cost)

As an action, I can spend 1 ki point to touch a creature and restore a number of its HP
   When I use Flurry of Blows, I can do this instead of one unarmed strike (no extra ki cost)

   When I use Flurry of Blows, I can do this instead of one unarmed strike (no extra ki cost)

   When I use Flurry of Blows, I can do this instead of one unarmed strike (no extra ki cost)

   When I use Flurry of Blows, I can do this instead of one unarmed strike (no extra ki cost)

   It also recovers from one disease or the blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned condition
   When I use Flurry of Blows, I can do this instead of one unarmed strike (no extra ki cost)

   It also recovers from one disease or the blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned condition
   When I use Flurry of Blows, I can do this instead of each unarmed strike (no extra ki cost)

   It also recovers from one disease or the blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned condition
   When I use Flurry of Blows, I can do this instead of each unarmed strike (no extra ki cost)

hands of harm.name: Hands of Harm
hands of harm.description:
When I hit a creature with an unarmed strike, I can spend 1 ki point to deal extra damage
   Only once per turn; If the target is incapacitated or poisoned, I roll the damage die 3 times

subclassfeature6.name: Noxious Aura
subclassfeature6.description:
[1 ki point]As a bonus action, I can spend 1 ki point to gain a 5-ft radius toxic aura for 1 minute
   While active, ranged attacks have disadv. vs. me; It ends if I'm incapacitated or dismiss it
   Others who start their turn in it must make a Con save or be poisoned and take damage
   They take my Wis mod in poison damage (min 0); Poisoned lasts until my next turn ends

subclassfeature11.name: Healing Technique
subclassfeature11.description: With hands of healing I can also end: 1 disease, blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned

hand of mercy.name: Hand of Mercy
hand of mercy.description:
As an action, I can use 4 ki to have a touched creature make a Con save (can fail willingly)
   If failed, it becomes paralyzed in a state of suspended animation for my monk level in days
   It also has immunity to all damage, and curses, diseases, poisons affecting it are suspended
   The creature appears dead to all inspection and to spells used to determine its status
   I can end the effect at will (no action required); I can have only one affected at a time

subclassfeature3.name: Channel Divinity: Watcher's Will
subclassfeature3.description: As an action, Cha mod of creatures I see in 30 ft adv. on Int/Wis/Cha saves for 1 min

subclassfeature3.1.name: Channel Divinity: Abjure the Extraplanar
subclassfeature3.1.description:
As an action, elementals, fey, fiends, and aberrations within 30 ft must make a Wis save
   Succeeds if it can't hear me; On fail, turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage
   Turned: move away, never within 30 ft of me, no reactions or actions other than Dash
   Turned: may Dodge instead of Dash when nowhere to move and unable to escape bonds

subclassfeature7.name: Aura of the Sentinel
subclassfeature7.description: If I'm not incapacitated, chosen creatures in range and I add my Cha mod to Initiative

addMod.text: I can add my Charisma modifier (min +1) to initiative rolls.

subclassfeature15.name: Vigilant Rebuke
subclassfeature15.description:
As a reaction when I or another I can see saves against a spell, I can damage the caster
   Has to succeed save within 30 ft of me vs. unwanted spell; 2d8 + Cha mod force damage

subclassfeature20.name: Mortal Bulwark
subclassfeature20.description:
As a bonus action, I can gain the following benefits for 1 minute:
    • Truesight out to 120 ft and adv. on attacks vs. elementals, fey, fiends, and aberrations
    • I can force creatures I hit and damage with an attack to make a Charisma save
      If failed, the target is banished to its native plane of existence if it's not currently there
      If successful, the creature can't be banished by this feature for 24 hours

subclassfeature1.name: Collector's Vessel
subclassfeature1.description:
My patron gives me a magical vessel, a Tiny object which I can use as a spellcasting focus
   If I lose it, I can perform a 1-hour ceremony during a rest to receive a replacement
   As an action while holding it, I can create a tether to a willing target I can see in 100 ft
   This lasts for 1 hour, until I do this again, or the tethered target is reduced to 0 HP
   It also ends when the tethered target ends its turn further than 100 ft from me
   While the tether lasts, I add my Cha mod (min +1) to my Wis (Perception) checks
   Also, I can have spells I cast originate from the tethered creature's space

subclassfeature6.name: Elemental Resistance
subclassfeature6.description:
When I finish a long rest, I can gain acid, cold, fire, or lightning resistance (my choice)
   This lasts until I finish my next long rest; A creature tethered to my vessel also gains this

subclassfeature10.name: Protective Wish
subclassfeature10.description:
As a reaction when I or my tethered creature is hit by an attack, we can swap places
   As we both teleport to each others location, the one hit by the attack switches as well

subclassfeature10.1.name: Genie's Entertainment
subclassfeature10.1.description:
As an action, I can have a creature I can see within 90 ft make a Charisma save
   If failed, it is drawn into my vessel and teleported to my patron's court for 1 minute
   In there it is stunned but unharmed; At the end of each of its turns it can save to return

subclassfeature14.name: Collector's Call
subclassfeature14.description:
As an action, I can implore my patron if I make a Persuasion check vs. my spell save DC
   If I fail, the use is wasted; If I succeed, I can choose one of the following effects:
    • A creature I can see in 60 ft heals 8d6 HP and 1 disease or condition affecting it ends
      This condition can be blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, paralyzed, or poisoned
    • A creature I can see in 60 ft has disadv. on attacks & saves until my next turn starts
    • I can cast Legend Lore without using material components
   I can regain a use of this by sacrificing 500 gp of nonmagical treasure to my patron

legend lore.description: Learn summary of lore of named or described person, place, or object
legend lore.changes: When I use my Collector's Call feature to cast Legend Lore, it doesn't require any material components.

subclassfeature24.name: Legacy spells
subclassfeature24.description: I can choose to access to the legacy version of spells

show legacy.name: Show legacy spells
show legacy.description: I have access to the legacy version of spells

hide legacy.name: Hide legacy spells
hide legacy.description: I have hidden the legacy version of spells

subclassfeature3.name: Note of Potential
subclassfeature3.description:
I can also grant a note of potential to whomever I give a bardic inspiration die
   This tiny, invulnerable object orbits in 5 ft; It enhances the use of the inspiration die:
   • Note of Destruction (used for attack roll): others within 5 ft must make a Con save
     If failed, they take the die roll in thunder damage; This uses my spell save DC
   • Note of Protection (used for save): Grants temp HP equal to the roll + my Cha mod
   • Note of Ingenuity (used for check): Roll the die twice and choose which result to use

subclassfeature6.name: Animating Performance
subclassfeature6.description:
As an action, I can animate a Large or smaller nonmagical item I can see within 30 ft
   It lasts for 1 hour or until it has 0 HP; I control it and it acts on my initiative, after me
   Unless I use a bonus action to command it, it only takes the Dodge action on its turn
   When I use bardic inspiration, I can command the item as part of the same bonus action
   I can't have multiple at once; Select "Dancing Item" on a companion page for its stats
   I can do this once per long rest, or by expending a 3rd-level or higher spell slot (SS 3+)

creatureOptions.name: Dancing Item
creatureOptions.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

features.name: Creator
features.description: The item obeys the commands of its creator and uses its creator's spell attack modifier for its attack rolls. It takes its turn immediately after its creator, on the same initiative count. It can move and take reactions on its own, but only takes the Dodge action on its turn unless its creator takes a bonus action to command to do otherwise, in which case it can only take the Dash, Force-Empowered Slam (and possibly Endless Waltz), Disengage, Help, Hide, or Search action.

actions.name: Immutable Form
actions.description: The item is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

actions.name: Endless Waltz
actions.description: Immediately after the item makes a slam attack, it can take the Dodge action as a bonus action.

hp.body: function(e,a,t){var n,i,o;classes.known.bard&&(n=Number(What("Cha Mod")),i=classes.known.bard.level,a.alt.push(a.conMod+n+(o=5*i)),a.altStr.push(" = "+a.conMod+" from its Constitution modifier\n + "+n+" from its creator's Charisma modifier\n + 5 × "+i+" from five times its creator's bard level ("+o+")"))}

subclassfeature14.name: Performance of Creation
description:
As an action, I create a Large or smaller nonmagical item in an empty space in 10 ft
   Max 20 gp value; I can't have multiple, creating more makes the first one vanish
   It vanishes when my next turn ends, unless I use my action to extend its life 1 extra turn
   If I sustain it for 1 minute this way, it continues to exists for my bard level in hours
   I can do this once per long rest, or by expending a 5th-level or higher spell slot (SS 5+)

   It vanishes when my next turn ends, unless I use my action to extend its life 1 extra turn

   I can do this once per long rest, or by expending a 5th-level or higher spell slot (SS 5+)

subclassfeature1.name: Emboldening Bond
description:
As an action, I can magically bond two willing targets I can see in 30 ft (can be me)
   While within 30 ft of the other, a bonded target can add +d4 to a save, attack, or check
   This can only be added once per turn; The bond lasts for 1 hour or until I use this again
   I can do this once per long rest, after which I can do so by expending a spell slot (SS 1+)

   This can only be added once per turn; The bond lasts for 1 hour or until I use this again

As an action, I can magically bond two willing targets I can see in 30 ft (can be me)
   While on the same plane, a bonded target can add +d4 to a save, attack, or check
   This can only be added once per turn; The bond lasts for 1 hour or until I use this again
   I can do this once per long rest, after which I can do so by expending a spell slot (SS 1+)

As an action, I can magically bond two willing targets I can see in 30 ft (can be me)
   While on the same plane, a bonded target can add +d4 to a save, attack, or check
   This can only be added once per turn; The bond lasts for 1 hour or until I use this again
   I can do this once per long rest, after which I can do so by expending a spell slot (SS 1+)

As an action, I can magically bond two willing targets I can see in 30 ft (can be me)
   While on the same plane, a bonded target can add +d4 to a save, attack, or check
   This can only be added once per turn; The bond lasts for 1 hour or until I use this again
   I can do this once per long rest, after which I can do so by expending a spell slot (SS 1+)

subclassfeature2.name: Channel Divinity: Shared Burden
subclassfeature2.description:
As a reaction when a creature I can see in 30 ft takes damage, I can divide that damage
   I then choose a number of willing creatures that I can see equal to my Wis mod (min 1)
   I distribute the damage over these and the original target, each taking at least 1 damage
   Damage resistances and vulnerabilities are only applied after the damage is distributed

subclassfeature6.name: Protective Bond
subclassfeature6.description:
My emboldening bond now also allows the two bonded to shield each other of damage
   When the other takes damage, one can use its reaction to give it resistance to all damage
   This resistance lasts until the end of the current turn
additional: the bonded must be within 30 ft

subclassfeature8.name: Potent Spellcasting
subclassfeature8.description: I add my Wisdom modifier to the damage I deal with my cleric cantrips

atkCalc: My cleric cantrips get my Wisdom modifier added to their damage.
spellAdd: My cleric cantrips get my Wisdom modifier added to their damage.

subclassfeature17.name: Enduring Unity
subclassfeature17.description:
The 30 ft restriction no longer applies to my emboldening and protective bond features
   My emboldening bond now also empowers a bonded if the other is reduced to 0 HP
   If that happens, the bonded creature above 0 HP gains the following benefits:
    • Advantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws; Resistance to all damage
    • As an action, it can touch its bonded partner to expend and roll HD to heal
   These benefits lasts for 1 minute or until the downed creature regains at least 1 HP

subclassfeature24.name: Legacy spells
subclassfeature24.description: I can choose to access to the legacy version of spells

show legacy.name: Show legacy spells
show legacy.description: I have access to the legacy version of spells

hide legacy.name: Hide legacy spells
hide legacy.description: I have hidden the legacy version of spells

subclassfeature1.name: Clockwork Magic
subclassfeature1.description: I learn additional spells, which do not count towards the number of spell I can know

subclassfeature1.1.name: Restore Balance
subclassfeature1.1.description:
As a reaction when a creature I can see in 60 ft is about to roll a d20 with adv./disadv.,
   I can prevent that roll from being affected by advantage and disadvantage.

subclassfeature6.name: Bulwark of Law
subclassfeature6.description:
As an action, I can imbue a creature I can see within 30 ft with a magical ward
   I grant it a number of d8s equal to the number of sorcery points I expend when I do this
   When it takes damage, it can use its reaction to spend and roll any number of those dice
   The dice roll reduces the damage; The ward lasts until I finish a long rest or do this again

subclassfeature14.name: Trance of Order
subclassfeature14.description:
As a bonus action, I can enter a state of clockwork consciousness for 1 minute
   While in this state, attack rolls against me can't benefit from advantage
   Also, I can then treat a d20 roll below 9 as a 10 for my attack rolls, checks, and saves
   I can do this once per long rest, or by expending a 5 sorcery points (5 SP)

subclassfeature18.name: Clockwork Cavalcade
subclassfeature18.description:
As an action, I can call spirits to bring balance in a 30-ft cube originating from me
   Inside the cube, the intangible spirits do all the following before vanishing:
    • Restore up to 100 HP, divided among the creatures in the cube as I see fit
    • Repair all damaged objects in the cube
    • End spells of my choice of 6th-level or lower on objects or creatures in the cube
   I can do this once per long rest, or by expending a 7 sorcery points (7 SP)

subclassfeature24.name: Legacy spells
subclassfeature24.description: I can choose to access to the legacy version of spells

show legacy.name: Show legacy spells
show legacy.description: I have access to the legacy version of spells
spellcastingExtra: protection from evil and good legacy

hide legacy.name: Hide legacy spells
hide legacy.description: I have hidden the legacy version of spells

legacySpells: protection from evil and good legacy

subclassfeature3.name: Tools of the Trade
subclassfeature3.description: [proficient with heavy armor & smith's tools]

subclassfeature3.1.name: Power Armor
subclassfeature3.1.description:
As an action, I can use smith's tool to turn a suit of heavy armor into power armor
   It continues to be power armor until I doff it, don another armor, or I die
   It can't be removed against my will, covers all my limbs, and even replaces missing limbs
   I ignore the Strength requirement of power armor and can use it as a spellcasting focus

subclassfeature3.2.name: Armor Model
subclassfeature3.2.description:
When I finish a rest, I can use smith's tools to change the model of my arcane armor
   Select a model using the "Choose Feature" button; See "Notes" page for features of each

toNotesPage.name: Power Armor Model Features
toNotesPage.note:
I can customize my power armor to the guardian or infiltrator model whenever I finish a short or long rest, provided I have smith's tools in hand.
   Each model includes a special weapon. When I attack with that weapon, I can use my Intelligence modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.

◆ Guardian Power Armor (Armorer 3, UA:SP3 2)• Thunder Gauntlets: The armored fists of the guardian power armor each count as a simple melee weapon, and each deals 1d8 thunder damage on a hit. A creature hit by the gauntlet has disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than me until the start of me next turn, as the armor magically emits a distracting pulse when the creature attacks someone else.
   • Defensive Field: As a bonus action, I can gain temporary hit points equal to my artificer level, replacing any temporary hit points I already have. I lose these temporary hit points if I doff the armor.

◆ Infiltrator Power Armor (Armorer 3, UA:SP3 2)• Lightning Launcher: A gemlike node on one of the armored fists or on the chest (my choice) counts as a simple ranged weapon, with a normal range of 90 ft and a long range of 300 ft. It deals 1d6 lightning damage on a hit. Once on each of my turns when I hit a creature with it, I can deal an extra 1d6 lightning damage to that target.
   • Powered Steps: My walking speed increases by 5 feet.
   • Second Skin: The armor's weight is negligible, and it becomes formfitting and wearable under clothing. If the armor normally imposes disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks, the power armor doesn't.

weaponOptions.name: Thunder Gauntlets
weaponOptions.description: Target hit disadv. on attacks vs. others than me until my next turn starts

weaponOptions.name: Lightning Launcher
weaponOptions.description: Once per turn on hit, +1d6 lightning damage

subclassfeature9.name: Armor Modifications
subclassfeature9.description:
Power armor now counts as armor, boots, bracers, and a weapon for holding infusions
   I can infuse two of those after a rest without counting towards the number of items
subclassfeature9.additional: +2 infused items, if used on power armor

subclassfeature15.name: Perfected Armor
subclassfeature15.description:
My armor gets additional features, based on the model; Use "Choose Features" to select it
   The guardian gets the ability to pull a creature closer as a reaction and make an attack
   The infiltrator gets an upgrade to its lightning launcher weapon attack

toNotesPage.name: Guardian Perfected Armor Features
toNotesPage.note:
Tinkering with my armor's energy system leads me to discover a powerful pulling force.
   As a reaction when a creature I can see ends its turn within 30 ft of me, I can force the creature to succeed on a Strength saving throw against my spell save DC or be pulled up to 30 ft toward me to an unoccupied space. If I pull the target to space within 5 ft of me, I can make a melee weapon attack against it as part of this reaction.
   I can use this reaction a number of times equal to my Intelligence modifier (min 1). I regain all expended uses of it when I finish a long rest.

◆ Infiltrator Perfected Armor Features (Armorer 15, UA:SP3 2)Any creature that takes lightning damage from my Lightning Launcher glimmers with light until the start of my next turn.
   The glimmering creature sheds dim light in a 5-ft radius, and the next attack roll against it by a creature other than me has advantage. If that attack hits, it deals an extra 1d6 lightning damage.

guardian.name: Perfected Armor: Guardian
guardian.description:
[Intelligence modifier per long rest]As a reaction when a creature I can see ends its turn in 30 ft, I have it make a Str save
   If it fails, I pull it up to 30 ft towards me to an empty space
   If I pull it within 5 ft, I can make a melee weapon attack vs. it as part of this reaction

infiltrator.name: Perfected Armor: Infiltrator
infiltrator.description:
Those hit by my lightning launcher shed 5-ft radius dim light until my next turn starts
   Also, the next attack roll made by another than me vs. the target has advantage
   If that attack hits, it deals an extra 1d6 lightning damage

subclassfeature2.name: Star Map
subclassfeature2.description:
I've created a star map, a Tiny object which I can use as my spellcasting focus
   If I lose it, I can perform a 1-hour ceremony during a rest to create a replacement
   I can use it to cast Augury or Guiding Bolt, even unprepared, without using a spell slot

subclassfeature2.1.name: Starry Form
subclassfeature2.1.description:
As an action, I can expend a use of wild shape to take on a starry form for 10 minutes
   In that form I shed bright light in a 10-ft radius and dim light for an extra 10-ft radius
   When I do so, I choose one constellation below to grant me benefits in my starry form:
   • Chalice: When I use a spell slot to cast a healing spell, I also heal a creature in 30 ft
     This can be myself or the original target; I restore 1d8 + half my druid level in HP
   • Archer: As a bonus action, I can make a ranged spell attack to hurl a luminous arrow
     This has a range of 60 ft and deals radiant damage equal to 1d8 + my Wisdom mod
   • Dragon: I can treat a roll below 10 as a 10 for Int/Wis checks and concentration saves

weaponOptions.name: Luminous Arrow
weaponOptions.description: Use as bonus action

subclassfeature6.name: Cosmic Omen
subclassfeature6.description:
When I finish a long rest, I can roll a die to gain an omen based on the result (odd/even)
   As a reaction when a creature I can see in 30 ft makes an attack, check, or save, I can:
   • Weal (even): add 1d6 to the number rolled for the attack, check, or save
   • Woe (odd): subtract 1d6 from the number rolled for the attack, check, or save

subclassfeature10.name: Full of Stars
subclassfeature10.description: While in my starry form, I have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage

star flare.name: Star Flare
star flare.description:
As an action, I conjure a 30-ft radius sphere of light on a point within 120 ft I can see
   I then teleport each willing creature in that sphere to an empty space within 30 ft of it
   Creatures left within the sphere must make a Con save or take 4d10 radiant damage
   Those that failed the save are also blinded until the end of my next turn
   I can do this once per long rest, or by expending a 5th-level or higher spell slot (SS 5+)

subclassfeature3.name: Fey Wanderer Magic
subclassfeature3.description: I get bonus spells known, which do not count against the number of spells I can know

subclassfeature3.1.name: Cunning Will
subclassfeature3.1.description: Adv. on saves vs. charm/frightened; Proficiency in Deception, Performance, or Persuasion
subclassfeature3.1.skillstxt: Choose one from: Deception, Performance, or Persuasion

subclassfeature3.2.name: Dreadful Strikes
subclassfeature3.2.description:
As a bonus action, I can imbue the weapons I'm holding with magic until my turn ends
   They count as magical and deal +1d6 psychic damage, but only once to a single creature
   I can also do this as part of the same bonus action as making an off-hand attack

subclassfeature7.name: Blessings of the Courts
subclassfeature7.description:
Once per turn when I hit a weapon attack, I can expend a spell slot for extra damage
   The target takes +3d6 psychic damage and must make a Wis save or be frightened of me
   This lasts until the end of my next turn; In addition, I add my Wis mod to Cha checks

addMod.text: I add my Wisdom modifier to my Charisma checks
I add my Wisdom modifier to my Charisma checks
I add my Wisdom modifier to my Charisma checks
I add my Wisdom modifier to my Charisma checks

subclassfeature11.name: Beguiling Twist
subclassfeature11.description:
As a reaction when a creature I can see in 120 ft succeeds a save vs. charmed/frightened
   I can have another I can see in 120 ft make a Wis save or suffer one effect of my choice:
    • For 1 min, it's frightened of me or charmed; It can save again at the end of its turns
    • It takes 3d10 psychic damage

misty presence.name: Misty Presence
misty presence.description:
As a bonus action, I can have a creature I can see within 30 ft make a Wisdom save
   On a failed save, it cannot see or hear me for 24 hours or until I use this feature again
   The target can repeat its save if I hit it with an attack, force it to save, or deal it damage
   On a successful save, the creature is immune to my use of this feature for 7 days
   I can do this once per long rest, or by expending a 4th-level or higher spell slot (SS 4+)

subclassfeature3.name: Whispers of the Dead
subclassfeature3.description:
Whenever I finish a short or long rest, I can gain one skill or tool proficiency of my choice
   This proficiency lasts until I use this feature again to gain a different proficiency
subclassfeature3.skillstxt: Choose one skill or tool; I can change the choice whenever I finish a short or long rest

subclassfeature3.1.name: Wails from the Grave
description:
Directly after I deal sneak attack damage to a creature on my turn, I can harm another
   I then deal half my sneak attack in psychic damage to a creature I can see within 30 ft

Directly after I deal sneak attack damage to a creature on my turn, I can harm another
   I then deal half my sneak attack in psychic damage to a creature I can see within 30 ft

Directly after I deal sneak attack damage to a creature on my turn, I can harm another
   I then deal half my sneak attack in psychic damage to a creature I can see within 30 ft

   I then deal half my sneak attack in psychic damage to a creature I can see within 30 ft

Directly after I deal sneak attack damage to a creature on my turn, I can harm another
   I then deal half my sneak attack in psychic damage to a creature I can see within 30 ft

Directly after I deal sneak attack damage to a creature on my turn, I also harm another
   I deal half my sneak attack in psychic damage to both it and another I can see in 30 ft

Directly after I deal sneak attack damage to a creature on my turn, I also harm another
   I deal half my sneak attack in psychic damage to both it and another I can see in 30 ft

Directly after I deal sneak attack damage to a creature on my turn, I also harm another
   I deal half my sneak attack in psychic damage to both it and another I can see in 30 ft

Directly after I deal sneak attack damage to a creature on my turn, I also harm another
   I deal half my sneak attack in psychic damage to both it and another I can see in 30 ft

subclassfeature9.name: Tokens of the Departed
subclassfeature9.description:
[max Proficiency Bonus of soul trinkets]As a reaction when I see a creature within 30 ft die, I can create a Tiny soul trinket
   The token of its life essence appears in my free hand; The DM determines its appearance
   While a soul trinket is on my person, I have advantage on death and Constitution saves
   As an action, I can destroy one of my soul trinkets and ask its associated spirit a question
   Its spirit appears and answers concisely in a language it knew; Trinket can be anywhere

text: While soul trinket is on me, Adv. on Con and death saves

subclassfeature13.name: Ghost Walk
subclassfeature13.description:
As a bonus action, I can assume a spectral form with 10 ft flying speed and can hover
   Attacks vs. me have disadv.; I can move through creatures and objects as difficult terrain
   This lasts 10 min; I take 1d10 force damage if I end my turn inside a creature or object
   I can assume this form once per long rest, or by destroying one of my soul trinkets (ST)

subclassfeature17.name: Death Knoll
subclassfeature17.description: Wails from the Grave now also deals damage to the target of the original sneak attack

subclassfeature3.name: Guiding Whispers
subclassfeature3.description: I learn the Guidance cantrip and can cast it with a range of 60 ft

guidance.changes: I can cast Guidance with a range of 60 ft.

subclassfeature3.1.name: Spiritual Focus
subclassfeature3.1.description: [only for bard spells]I can use a candle, crystal ball, skull, spirit board, or tarokka deck as a spellcasting focus

subclassfeature3.2.name: Tales from Beyond
subclassfeature3.2.description:
As a bonus action, I can expend a bardic inspiration die to roll on the Spirits' Tales table
   I retain the rolled tale in my mind until I bestow its effects or finish a short or long rest
   I can only retain one tale at a time; I need to hold a spiritual focus to roll on the table
   As an action, I can choose a creature I see in 30 ft or myself to bestow the tale's effect
   The tales use my spell save DC; See the Notes page for the Spirits' Tales table

toNotesPage.name: Spirits' Tales Table
toNotesPage.note:
As a bonus action while I'm holding my spiritual focus, I can reach out to spirits who tell their tales through me. I expend one use of my Bardic Inspiration and roll on the table below using my Bardic Inspiration die to determine the tale. I retain the tale in mind until I bestow the tale's effect or finish a short or long rest.
   I can retain only one of these tales in mind at a time, and rolling on the table immediately ends the effect of the previous tale.
   As an action, I can choose myself or one creature I can see within 30 ft to be the target of the tale's effect. If the tale requires a saving throw, the DC equals my spell save DC.
   
Roll  Tale  1    Beast: I recite the tale of a clever animal. For 1 minute, the target has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and advantage on attack rolls against a creature if another enemy is within 5 ft of it, and that enemy isn't incapacitated.
  2    Warrior: I recount the story of a renowned duelist. Make a melee spell attack against the target as an attacking spectral warrior briefly appears in a unoccupied space within 5 ft of the target before vanishing. On a hit, the target takes force damage equal to two rolls of my Bardic Inspiration die + my Charisma modifier.
  3    Friends: I recite the tale of friends who found each other in the afterlife. The target and another creature of its choice it can see within 5 ft of it regains hit points equal to a roll of my Bardic Inspiration die + my Charisma modifier.
  4    Runaway: I tell the tale of an adventurer that could escape any confinement. The target can immediately use its reaction to teleport up to 30 ft to an unoccupied space it can see. When the target teleports, it can choose a number of creatures it can see within 30 ft of it up to my Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) to immediately use the same reaction.
  5    Avenger: I recount the tale of an avenging knight. For 1 minute, whenever a creature the target can see within 30 ft of it is damaged by a creature, the target can use its reaction to deal force damage equal to a roll of my Bardic Inspiration die to the attacker.
  6    Hero: I speak the tale of an epic hero. The target gains temporary hit points equal to a roll of my Bardic Inspiration die + my bard level. While it has these temporary hit points, the target's walking speed increases by 10 ft.
  7    Fey: I recount the tale of a mischievous fey. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become charmed by me until the end of its next turn. The charmed target must use its action to make a melee attack against a creature other than itself that I mentally choose. The target can act normally on its turn if I choose no other creature.
  8    Dark Spirit: I speak a dreadful tale of a slayer in the dark. The target becomes invisible until the end of its next turn or until it hits a creature with an attack. If it hits a creature with an attack during this invisibility, that creature takes necrotic damage equal to a roll of my Bardic Inspiration die and is frightened of the target until the end of its next turn.
  9    Giant: I speak of the deeds of a mighty giant. Each creature of the target's choice it can see within 30 ft of it must make a Strength saving throw, taking force damage equal to two rolls of my Bardic Inspiration die on a failed save and is knocked prone. A creature that succeeds on its saving throw takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone.
 10    Dragon: I breathe a poem of a wrathful dragon. The target magically spews fire from their mouth in a 30-ft cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking fire damage equal to three rolls of my Bardic Inspiration die on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
 11    Celestial: I speak of the exalted deeds of a celestial. The target regains hit points equal to two rolls of my Bardic Inspiration die + my bard level, and I end one disease or a condition from the following list affecting the target: blinded, deafened, paralyzed, petrified, or poisoned.
 12    Unknown: I utter an incomprehensible fable from a being beyond the stars. The target must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or take psychic damage equal to three rolls of my Bardic Inspiration die, and the target is unable to speak any language for 1 minute.

subclassfeature6.name: Spiritual Focus: Improve spells
subclassfeature6.description: While holding a spiritual focus, I can add 1d6 to one damage or healing roll of bard spells

atkAdd.body: function(e,a,t){var n,i;a.thisWeapon[3]&&SpellsList[a.thisWeapon[3]]&&-1!==a.thisWeapon[4].indexOf("bard")&&(i="raw: only +1d6 for spells with non-costly material components"===GetFeatureChoice("classes","bard","subclassfeature6"),n=SpellsList[a.thisWeapon[3]],!i||n.components&&/\bM\b/.test(n.components)&&!/M\u0192|M\u2020/.test(n.components))&&(e.Damage_Die=e.Damage_Die.replace(/D/g,"d"),i=/(\d+)d6/,-1!=e.Damage_Die.indexOf("Bd6")?e.Damage_Die=e.Damage_Die.replace("Bd6","Cd6"):-1!=e.Damage_Die.indexOf("Cd6")?e.Damage_Die=e.Damage_Die.replace("Cd6","Qd6"):i.test(e.Damage_Die)?e.Damage_Die=e.Damage_Die.replace(i,Number(e.Damage_Die.replace(i,"$1"))+1+"d6"):"eldritch blast"==a.thisWeapon[3]?e.Description+=(e.Description?"; ":"")+"One ray +1d6 dmg":e.Damage_Die+="+1d6")}

atkAdd:
When I cast a bard spell, I can use my spiritual focus to add 1d6 to one damage roll or roll to restore hit points.
   Going by rules as written (RAW), the spiritual focus has to be used as a spellcasting focus for this bonus to be added. This means that it can only be used on spells with a non-costly material component. Most DMs will forgo this technicality and that is why this sheet will add the 1d6 to any damage/healing spell by default. You can enable to use the stricter rules as written with the "Choose Feature" button on the second page.

spellAdd.body: function(e,a,t){var n="raw: only +1d6 for spells with non-costly material components"===GetFeatureChoice("classes","bard","subclassfeature6");if(!a.psionic&&"bard"===t&&(!n||a.components&&/\bM\b/.test(a.components)&&!/M\u0192|M\u2020/.test(a.components)))return!(!genericSpellDmgEdit(e,a,"\\w+\\.?","1d6",!0,!0)&&!genericSpellDmgEdit(e,a,"heal","1d6",!0,!0))||void 0}

spellAdd:
When I cast a bard spell, I can use my spiritual focus to add 1d6 to one damage roll or roll to restore hit points.
   Going by rules as written (RAW), the spiritual focus has to be used as a spellcasting focus for this bonus to be added. This means that it can only be used on spells with a non-costly material component. Most DMs will forgo this technicality and that is why this sheet will add the 1d6 to any damage/healing spell by default. You can enable to use the stricter rules as written with the "Choose Feature" button on the second page.

choices: RAW: only +1d6 for spells with non-costly material components

raw: only +1d6 for spells with non-costl.name: Spiritual Focus: Improve spells
raw: only +1d6 for spells with non-costl.description: If I use a spiritual focus to cast a bard spell, I can add 1d6 to one damage or healing roll

allow +1d6 for any bard spell.name: Spiritual Focus: Improve spells
allow +1d6 for any bard spell.description: While holding a spiritual focus, I can add 1d6 to one damage or healing roll of bard spells

subclassfeature6.1.name: Spirit Session
subclassfeature6.1.description:
Using my spiritual focus, I can conduct a hour-long ritual to channel spirit during a rest
   The number of willing participants, me included, can be up to my Proficiency Bonus
   At the end, I learn a divination or necromancy spell of my choice until I start a long rest
   The spell can't be higher level than the number of participants and of a level I can cast

subclassfeature14.name: Mystical Connection
subclassfeature14.description:
I can roll a d6 instead of expending a bardic inspiration die when I do Tales from Beyond
   Even if I roll a d6, I still roll my bardic inspiration die for the effect, but not expend it

subclassfeature1.name: Form of Dread
subclassfeature1.description:
As a bonus action, I can transform for 1 minute and gain the following benefits:
    • I gain temporary hit points equal to 1d10 + my warlock level
    • I am immune to the frightened condition
    • Once per turns when I hit an attack, I can force the target to make a Wis save
      If the target fails this save, it is frightened of me until the end of my next turn

subclassfeature6.name: Grave Touched
subclassfeature6.description:
I no longer need to eat, drink, or breathe
   When I damage a creature with an attack, I can change the damage type to necrotic
   While I'm in my Form of Dread, I can roll one extra damage die for this necrotic damage

subclassfeature10.name: Mortal Husk
subclassfeature10.description:
I have resistance to necrotic damage, or immunity while I'm in my Form of Dread
   When I'm reduced to 0 HP, I can cause my body to explode and I revive with 1 HP after
   Each creature of my choice within 30 ft takes 2d10 + my warlock level necrotic damage
   After this, I gain 1 level of exhaustion and must complete 1d4 long rests to do so again

subclassfeature14.name: Spirit Projection
subclassfeature14.description:
As an action, I can project my spirit from my body, leaving it suspended and unconscious
   This lasts 1 hour or until my concentration is broken; Damage and effects affect both
   When it ends, I can have my spirit return to my body or my body teleport to my spirit
   My spirit has my abilities, but no gear; While projecting I gain the following benefits:
    • My spirit and body gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage
    • My conjuration/necromancy spells need no verbal, somatic, non-costly material comp.
    • I gain a flying speed equal to my walking speed and can hover
    • Move through creatures/objects as difficult terrain; 1d10 force damage if end turn in
    • While in my Form of Dread, once per turns when I deal necrotic damage, I can heal
      I regain hit points equal to half the amount of necrotic damage dealt

subclassfeature24.name: Legacy spells
subclassfeature24.description: I can choose to access to the legacy version of spells

show legacy.name: Show legacy spells
show legacy.description: I have access to the legacy version of spells

hide legacy.name: Hide legacy spells
hide legacy.description: I have hidden the legacy version of spells

subclassfeature3.name: Draconic Disciple
subclassfeature3.description:
I can change the damage type of my unarmed strikes to acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison
   As a reaction when I fail an Intimidation or Persuasion check, I can reroll the check
   If this turns it into a success, I can't do so again until I finish a long rest; I learn Draconic

atkAdd: When I damage a target with an unarmed strike, I can change the damage type to acid, cold, fire, lightning or poison.

breath of the dragon.name: Breath of the Dragon
description:
When I take the Attack action on my turn, I can replace one attack with a breath weapon
   This deals 2d4 acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison (my choice) damage to all in the area
   The area can be a 20-ft cone or a 5-ft wide, 30-ft line; Dex save to halve the damage
   I can do this my Proficiency Bonus times per long rest, or by expending 1 ki point

weaponOptions.name: Breath of the Dragon
weaponOptions.description: All in area; Dex save for half damage; Alt: 20-ft cone; Type: acid/cold/fire/lightning/poison

atkAdd: My Breath of the Dragon deals damage equal to two rolls of my Martials Arts die. At 11th level, this increases to three rolls of my Martial Arts die. At 17th level, the energy clings to the target. At the start of each of a target's turns, it takes damage of the type the breath dealt equal to one roll of my Martial Arts die. At the end of its turn, the creature can repeat the save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

subclassfeature6.name: Wings Unfurled
subclassfeature6.description:
[Prof B. / long rest or 1 ki]When I use Step of the Wind, I can gain a flying speed equal to my walking speed
   I can do this Prof Bonus per long rest, or by using 2 ki points to use Step of the Wind

aspect of the wyrm.name: Aspect of the Wyrm
description:
As a bonus action, I can activate a 30 ft aura of draconic power that lasts for 1 minute
   I choose acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage when I activate this aura
   My allies in the aura and myself gain resistance to the chosen damage type
   When an attack hits one of us, the one hit can use their reaction to damage the attacker
   This damage is of the chosen damage type, equal to one roll of my martial arts
   I can activate this aura once per long rest, or by expending 4 ki points

subclassfeature17.name: Ascendant Aspect
subclassfeature17.description: I gain 30 ft blindsight and both Breath of the Dragon and Aspect of the Wyrm improve

subclassfeature3.name: Draconic Gift
subclassfeature3.description: I learn the Draconic language and the Thaumaturgy cantrip

subclassfeature3.1.name: Drake Companion
subclassfeature3.1.description:
As an action, I can summon my drake to an empty space within 30 ft that I can see
   Select a "Drake Companion" on the companion page for its stats and rules
   I can do this once per long rest, or by expending a 1st-level or higher spell slot (SS 1+)

creatureOptions.name: Drake Companion
creatureOptions.damage_immunities: the chosen Draconic Essence damage type

attacks.name: Bite
attacks.description: Only 1d6 is piercing damage, the rest is of the chosen Draconic Essence damage type

features.name: Warden
features.description: The drake obeys the commands of its warden and shares its proficiency bonus. It takes its turn immediately after that of its warden, on the same initiative. It can move and take reactions on its own, but only takes the Dodge action on its turn unless its warden takes a bonus action to command it to take another action. If its warden is incapacitated, the drake can take any action, not just Dodge. The drake vanishes after a number of hours equal to its proficiency bonus, when it is reduced to 0 hit points, when its warden summons another drake, or when its warden dies.

traits.name: Draconic Essence
traits.description: When the drake is summoned, choose a damage type: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison.

traits.name: Infused Strikes
traits.description: As a reaction when another creature within 30 ft of the drake that it can see hits with a weapon attack, the drake can infuse the strike with its essence, causing the attack to deal an extra 1d6 damage of its chosen Draconic Essence damage type

traits.name: Bond of Fang and Scale (Drakewarden 7)
traits.description: When the drake is summoned, it gains either a 40 ft swimming speed and can breathe underwater, or a 40 ft flying speed and has wings. The drake's bite deals an extra 1d6 damage of its chosen Draconic Essence type.

addMod.text: The drake's bite attack deals an extra 1d6 damage of the type chosen for its Draconic Essence.

traits.name: Perfected Bond (Drakewarden 15)
traits.description: The drake's size is now Large and its bite attack deals an extra 1d6 damage (for a total of +2d6) of its chosen Draconic Essence type.

addMod.text: The drake's bite attack deals another extra 1d6 damage (for a total of +2d6) of the type chosen for its Draconic Essence.

hp.body: function(e,a,t){var n,i;(classes.known.ranger||classes.known.rangerua)&&(n=(classes.known.ranger||classes.known.rangerua).level,a.alt.push(5+(i=5*n)),a.altStr.push(" = 5 as a base\n + 5 × "+n+" from five times its warden's ranger level ("+i+")"))}

subclassfeature7.name: Bond of Fang and Scale
subclassfeature7.description:
When I summon my drake I can choose for it to have 40 ft flying or swimming speed
   If I choose swimming, it also gains the ability to breathe underwater
   The drake's bite attack deals an extra 1d6 damage chosen by its Draconic Essense
   While it is summoned, I gain resistance to the damage type of its Draconic Essense

subclassfeature11.name: Drake's Breath
subclassfeature11.description:
As an action, I can cause my drake or myself to exhale a 30-ft cone breath weapon
   Its damage type is acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison; Dex save to halve the damage
   I can do this once per long rest, or by expending a 3rd-level or higher spell slot (SS 3+)

weaponOptions.name: Drake's Breath
weaponOptions.description: Hits all in area; Dex save for half damage; Damage type: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison

atkCalc.body: function(e,a,t){a.theWea.DrakewardenDrakeBreath&&classes.known.rangerua&&(a.theWea.useSpellMod="rangerua")}

subclassfeature15.name: Perfected Bond
subclassfeature15.description:
My drake is now Large and its bite deals +1d6 damage chosen by its Draconic Essence
   As a reaction when the drake or I take damage while within 30 ft of each other,
   I can give myself or the drake resistance to that instance of damage

subclassfeature1.name: Moon Fire
subclassfeature1.description: I know the Sacred Flame cantrip and can use it on 2 creatures within 5 ft of each other

sacred flame.description: Up to 2 creas I see, max 5 ft apart, save or 1d8 Radiant dmg; no cover bonus; +1d8 at CL 5, 11, and 17
sacred flame.descriptionShorter: Up to 2 creas I see, max 5 ft apart, save or 1d8 Radiant dmg; no cover bonus; +1d8 CL 5/11/17
sacred flame.descriptionCantripDie: Up to 2 creas I see, max 5 ft apart, save or `CD`d8 Radiant dmg; no bonus for cover on save
sacred flame.changes: When I cast Sacred Flame, I can target one creature as normal or target two creatures within range that are within 5 feet of each other.

atkAdd.body: function(e,a){"sacred flame"==a.baseWeaponName&&(e.Description=e.Description.replace("1 creature","up to 2 creatures within 5 ft"))}

atkAdd: When I cast Sacred Flame, I can target one creature as normal or target two creatures within range that are within 5 feet of each other.

subclassfeature1.1.name: Lunar Embodiment
description:
When I finish a long rest, I can choose a lunar phase: Full, New, or Crescent Moon
   I can cast the spells of the chosen lunar phase each once per long rest without a spell slot
   ○ Full: Faerie Fire
   ● New: Dissonant Whispers
   ◖ Crescent: Sanctuary

When I finish a long rest, I can choose a lunar phase: Full, New, or Crescent Moon
   I can cast the spells of the chosen lunar phase each once per long rest without a spell slot
   ○ Full: Faerie Fire
   ● New: Dissonant Whispers
   ◖ Crescent: Sanctuary

   I can cast the spells of the chosen lunar phase each once per long rest without a spell slot
   ○ Full: Faerie Fire, Moonbeam
   ● New: Dissonant Whispers, Darkness
   ◖ Crescent: Sanctuary, Blindness/deafness

spellAdd.body: function(e,a,t,n){if("sorcerer"===t&&!n&&-1!==CurrentSpells.sorcerer.extra.indexOf(e)){var i,o={F:["faerie fire","moonbeam","death ward","freedom of movement","mass cure wounds"],N:["dissonant whispers","darkness","bestow curse","evard's black tentacles","mislead"],C:["sanctuary","blindness/deafness","phantom steed","hallucinatory terrain","dream"]};for(i in o)if(-1!==o[i].indexOf(e))return a.firstCol=i,!0}}

spellAdd: The letters "F", "N", or "C" in the first column are used to indicate that a spell belongs to either the Full Moon, New Moon, or Crescent Moon lunar phase.

subclassfeature6.name: Lunar Boons
subclassfeature6.description:
Each lunar phase is additionally associated with spells of the following schools of magic:
   ○ Full: Abjur & Conj		● New: Evoc & Necro	       ◖ Crescent: Div & Trans
   I can reduce the sorcery point needed for Metamagic of spells of my current phase by 1

subclassfeature6.1.name: Waxing and Waning
subclassfeature6.1.description: As a bonus action, I can spend 1 sorcery point to change my lunar phase

subclassfeature14.name: Lunar Empowerment
subclassfeature14.description:
[passive benefits for current phase]○ Full: I shed bright light in a 10-ft radius and dim light for an additional 10 ft
           Myself and creatures I choose inside this bright light have advantage on saves
   ● New: Adv. on Stealth checks; If I'm in dim light or darkness, attacks have disadv. vs me
   ◖ Crescent: I have resistance to Necrotic and Radiant damage

subclassfeature18.name: Lunar Phenomenon
subclassfeature18.description:
[per phase: 1× per long rest or 5 SP]As a bonus action, or as part of changing phase, I can use a power of the (new) phase:
   ○ Full: Chosen creatures within 30 ft of me must make a Constitution save or be blinded
      This lasts until their next turn ends; I also heal one creature within 30 ft for 3d8 HP
   ● New: Chosen creatures within 30 ft of me must make a Dexterity save
      If failed, they take 3d10 Necrotic damage and have 0 speed until their next turn ends
      Also, I become invisible until the end of my next turn, or until I attack or cast a spell
   ◖ Crescent: I can magically teleport to an unoccupied space I can see within 60 ft
      I gain resistance to all damage until the start of my next turn
   I can use each phase's bonus action 1/LR, or by spending 5 sorcery points to use it again

subclassfeature3.name: Giant Power
subclassfeature3.description: I learn Giant, and the Druidcraft or Thaumaturgy cantrip with Wis as spellcasting ability

subclassfeature6.name: Elemental Cleaver

   As a bonus action, I can change the chosen type; The bonuses only function for me

atkAdd.body: function(e,a){var t,n,i,o,s;(a.isMeleeWeapon||a.isRangedWeapon)&&classes.known.barbarian&&classes.known.barbarian.level&&/^(?=.*elemental)(?=.*cleaver).*$/i.test(a.WeaponTextName)&&(e.Damage_Type="Varies",o=/\bthrown\b/i.test(a.WeaponText),t=classes.known.barbarian.level<14?"+1d6 damage":"+2d6 damage",n=a.isRangedWeapon&&!o?"Thrown (20/60 ft), returning; ":o?"Returning; ":"Thrown, returning; ",(i=/\d+ ?(f.{0,2}t|m)/i.test(e.Range))?a.isRangedWeapon&&!o||!i||(1===(a=e.Range.match(/\d+([.,]\d+)?/g)).length?(s=Number(a[0].replace(",",".")))<60&&(tempRange=e.Range.replace(s,"long_range")):(o=Number(a[0].replace(",",".")),s=Number(a[1].replace(",",".")),tempRange=e.Range,o<20&&(tempRange=tempRange.replace(o,"short_range")),s<60&&(tempRange=tempRange.replace(s,"long_range"))),e.Range=tempRange.replace("short_range",20).replace("long_range",60)):e.Range+=", 20/60 ft",e.Description+=(e.Description?"; ":"")+n+t)}

atkAdd: If I include the words 'Elemental Cleaver' in a weapon's name, the Elemental Cleaver infused weapon properties will be added to it and its damage type will be set to 'Acid'. Also, my Rage's bonus damage will be added to it if it is a melee weapon that uses Strength.

atkCalc.body: function(e,a,t){a.isMeleeWeapon&&1===e.Mod&&classes.known.barbarian&&classes.known.barbarian.level&&/^(?!.*\brage\b)(?=.*elemental)(?=.*cleaver).*$/i.test(a.WeaponTextName)&&(t.extraDmg+=classes.known.barbarian.level<9?2:classes.known.barbarian.level<16?3:4)}

subclassfeature10.name: Mighty Impel
description:
[DC 8 + Prof Bonus + Str mod]As a bonus action while raging, I can hurl a Medium or smaller creature within my reach
   I move it to an empty space I can see within 30 ft; Unwilling can save to avoid this
   If it doesn't end this movement on a surface that can support it, it falls and lands prone

subclassfeature14.name: Demiurgic Colossus
subclassfeature14.description:
While raging, my reach increases by 10 ft, and my size can increase to Huge
   Mighty Impel works on Large creatures; Elemental Cleaver increases to +2d6 damage

subclassfeature2.name: Keeper of Old
subclassfeature2.description: I gain proficiency in History; I can add d4 to my Intelligence (History) checks

subclassfeature2.1.name: Primeval Companion
subclassfeature2.1.description:
As an action, I can expend a use of wild shape to summon a primeval companion
   The companion appears in an empty spot within 30 ft with the appearance of my choice
   It vanishes when reduced to 0 hit points, when I die, and when I summon another one

creatureOptions.name: Primeval Companion
creatureOptions.languages: Understands the languages of its summoner

attacks.name: Strike
attacks.description: My choice of bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage

features.name: Primeval Companion
features.description: The primeval companion obeys the commands of its summoner and shares its proficiency bonus. It takes its turn immediately after that of its summoner, on the same initiative. It can move and take reactions on its own, but only takes the Dodge action on its turn unless its summoner takes a bonus action to command it to take another action. If its summoner is incapacitated, the companion can take any action, not just Dodge. The companion vanishes when it is reduced to 0 hit points, when its summoner summons another companion, or when its summoner dies.

traits.name: Intercept attack
traits.description: As a reaction when a creature the companion can see hits a target within 5 ft of the companion with an attack, the target instead takes half the damage. The companion takes the remainder of the damage

traits.name: Prehistoric Conduit (Circle of the Primeval 6)
traits.description: Spells cast by the companion's summoner with a range other than self can originate from the companion instead. Also, the companion has advantage on saving throws against spells cast by its summoner. If the companion would normally take half damage on a successful save against these spells, instead, it takes no damage on a success and half and no other effects on a fail.

traits.name: Titanic Bond (Circle of the Primeval 10)
traits.description: The companion's size is now Large and it gains either a swimming or climbing speed equal to its walking speed.

hp.body: function(e,a,t){var n,i;classes.known.druid&&(n=classes.known.druid.level,a.alt.push(10+(i=5*n)),a.altStr.push(" = 10 as a base\n + 5 × "+n+" from five times its summoner's druid level ("+i+")"))}

subclassfeature6.name: Prehistoric Conduit
subclassfeature6.description:
Spells I cast with the range of touch can originate from my primeval companion
   The primeval companion has advantage on saving throws against my spells
   If the companion would take half damage on a successful save against a spell I cast,
   it instead takes no damage on a success and half damage and no other effects on a fail

subclassfeature10.name: Titanic Bond
subclassfeature10.description:
My companion grows to Large; it gains a climb or swim speed equal to its walking speed
   When I hit an attack or spell damage a creature I can see, I can have it make a Wis save
   If failed, the target is frightened of me until the end of my next turn
   I can do this only while my primeval companion is summoned, and only once per turn

subclassfeature14.name: Scourge of the Ancients
subclassfeature14.description:
When I use a bonus action to command my companion, I can expend a spell slot so that:
    • It becomes Huge if there is room, and gains 10 times the spell slot level in temp HP
    • On a hit, the companion's Strike deals an extra 1d8 + the spell slot level damage
    • Its walking (and climbing or swimming) speed increases with 5 ft per spell slot level
   These benefits last for 1 hour, until the companion vanishes, or until I use this again

subclassfeature2.name: Runes of Understanding
subclassfeature2.description:
I always have Comprehend Languages prepared and can cast it without using a spell slot
   It doesn't count against the number of spells I can prepare

subclassfeature2.1.name: Runic Empowerment
subclassfeature2.1.description:
When I cast a spell using a spell slot, I can invoke one of the following runes:
    • Life Rune: Me or a creature I can see within 30 ft gains 5 temp HP per spell slot level
    • War Rune: A creature I can see within 30 ft is marked until the end of my next turn
      Attack rolls against it gain a bonus equal to half the spell slot level, rounded up
    • Wind Rune: Until my next turn starts, my speed increases by 5 ft per spell slot level
      Additionally, my movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks

subclassfeature6.name: Sigils of Warding
subclassfeature6.description:
As a reaction when I fail a Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution save, I can call on a rune
   I expend a use of my Runic Empowerment feature and succeed on the save instead

subclassfeature10.name: Rune Maven
subclassfeature10.description:
Whenever I use Arcane Recovery, I also regain uses of Runic Empowerment
   I regain a number of uses equal to half my Intelligence modifier, rounded up (min 1)

subclassfeature14.name: Engraved Enmity
subclassfeature14.description:
As a bonus action, I can have a creature I can see within 60 ft make a Wisdom save
   If failed, it is marked by an enmity rune for 1 min, or until I lose my concentration
   A glowing energy mote hovers over the marked and it suffers the following effects:
    • The marked has disadvantage on saving throws against spells I cast
    • The glow makes the marked visible even if invisible, and they can't become invisible
    • When marking and as a bonus action on subsequent turns, I can curse the creature
      The next time an ally hits the cursed with an attack, it also takes 1d8 force damage
   I can do this once per long rest, or by expending a 3rd-level or higher spell slot (SS 3+)

subclassfeature1.name: Omens and Portents
subclassfeature1.description:
I can cast Augury once per long rest without using a spell slot or requiring components
   Once I do, my divination spells have -25% of no/random answer until I finish a long rest

augury.changes: Using Omens and Portents, I can cast Augury once per long rest without expending a spell slot or requiring components.

subclassfeature1.1.name: Thies That Bind
subclassfeature1.1.description:
As an action, I can magically tie my fate to a creature or object I touch for 1 hour
   Unwilling creatures can make a Wisdom save to resist; It ends early if I do this again
   I know the direction to a bound target's location and the direction of its movement
   Once per turn, a spell I cast on the target using a spell slot gets +1d6 damage or healing

subclassfeature2.name: Channel Divinity: Strands of Fate
subclassfeature2.description:
As a bonus action, I can manipulate the strands of fate for 1 minute while concentrating
   As a reaction when a creature I see makes a check or attack, I can impose adv. or disadv.

subclassfeature6.name: Insightful Striking
subclassfeature6.description:
As a bonus action, I can gain a brief vision of the defenses of a creature I see within 30 ft
   Until the end of my next turn, I gain one of the following effects:
    • I add 1d6 to my next attack roll against the target 
    • The target subtracts 1d6 from the next saving throw it makes against a spell I cast

subclassfeature8.name: Potent Spellcasting
subclassfeature8.description: I add my Wisdom modifier to the damage I deal with my cleric cantrips

atkCalc: My cleric cantrips get my Wisdom modifier added to their damage.
spellAdd: My cleric cantrips get my Wisdom modifier added to their damage.

subclassfeature17.name: Visions of the Future
subclassfeature17.description: Once per long rest, I can cast Foresight without a spell slot with a duration of 1 minute

foresight.changes: Using Visions of the Future, I can cast Foresight once per long rest without expending a spell slot; when I cast the spell in this way, the spell's duration is 1 minute for that casting.

subclassfeature24.name: Legacy spells
subclassfeature24.description: I can choose to access to the legacy version of spells

show legacy.name: Show legacy spells
show legacy.description: I have access to the legacy version of spells

hide legacy.name: Hide legacy spells
hide legacy.description: I have hidden the legacy version of spells

subclassfeature3.name: Frenzy
subclassfeature3.description:
As a bonus action each turn while raging, I can make a melee attack
   After my rage is over, I suffer one level of exhaustion

subclassfeature6.name: Mindless Rage
subclassfeature6.description: While raging, I can't be charmed or frightened, and such effects are suspended

subclassfeature10.name: Intimidating Presence
subclassfeature10.description:
As an action, frighten one creature in 30 ft for one turn if it fails a Wisdom save
   This effect ends if the creature is out of line of sight or more than 60 ft away
   If a creature succeeds its saving throw, it is immune for 24 hours

subclassfeature14.name: Retaliation
subclassfeature14.description: When an enemy within 5 ft damages me, I can make a melee attack as a reaction

subclassfeature3.name: Animal Speaker
subclassfeature3.description: Cast *Beast Sense* and *Speak with Animals* as Rituals using Wisdom.

subclassfeature3.1.name: Rage of the Wilds
subclassfeature3.1.description: Choose a Rage of the Wilds animal aspect when I enter a Rage (See Third Page).

bear.name: Bear
bear.description: Resistance to all but Force, Necrotic, Psychic, and Radiant damage.

eagle.name: Eagle
eagle.description: Disengage and Dash as a Bonus Action.

wolf.name: Wolf
wolf.description: Allies have Advantage on attacks against enemies within 5 feet of me.

subclassfeature6.name: Aspect of the Wilds

owl.name: Owl
owl.description: I have Darkvision with a range of 60 feet. If I already have Darkvision, its range increases by 60 feet.

panther.name: Panther
panther.description: I have a Climb Speed equal to my Speed

salmon.name: Salmon
salmon.description: I have a Swim Speed equal to my Speed

subclassfeature6.description: Use 'Choose Feature' button to choose an Aspect of the Wilds. Whenever I finish a Long Rest, I can change my choice.

subclassfeature10.name: Nature Speaker
subclassfeature10.description: I can cast the Commune with Nature spell but only as a Ritual. Wisdom is my spellcasting ability for it.

subclassfeature14.name: Power of the Wilds
subclassfeature14.description: When I enter a Rage, I gain the Benefits of an animal aspect from the Rage of the Wilds Feature and one animal aspect from this Feature (See Third Page).

falcon.name: Falcon
falcon.description: Fly Speed equals my Speed without armor.

lion.name: Lion
lion.description: Enemies with in 5 ft of me have Disadvantage on attacks against targets other than me or another Barbarian w/ this feature.

ram.name: Ram
ram.description: Knock Large or smaller creatures Prone when hit with melee attack.

subclassfeature3.name: Vitality of the Tree
subclassfeature3.description:
Vitality Surge : Gain Temporary Hit Points equal to my Barbarian level when I Rage.
   Life-Giving Force : Each turn, give a nearby creature Temporary Hit Points by rolling d6s equal to my Rage Damage bonus. All vanish when rage ends.

subclassfeature6.name: Branches of the Tree
subclassfeature6.description: As a Reaction, force a creature within 30 feet to make a Strength save (DC 8 + Strength mod + Proficiency), or be teleported to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of me and reduce its Speed to 0 until the end of the turn.

subclassfeature10.name: Battering Roots
subclassfeature10.description: Extend reach by 10 feet with Heavy or Versatile weapons. Use Push or Topple mastery properties when hitting with such weapons in addition to a different property.

subclassfeature14.name: Travel Along the Tree
subclassfeature14.description: Teleport up to 60 feet as a Bonus Action while Raging. Once per Rage, extend range to 150 feet and bring up to six creatures within 10 feet.

subclassfeature3.name: Divine Fury
subclassfeature3.description:
While raging, the first creature I hit with a weapon attack in my turn gets extra damage
   This is necrotic or radiant damage equal to 1d6 + half my barbarian level
   Choose a damage type using the "Choose Feature" button above

necrotic damage.name: Divine Fury
necrotic damage.description:
While raging, the first creature I hit with a weapon attack in my turn gets extra damage
   It takes an extra 1d6 + half my barbarian level worth of necrotic damage

radiant damage.name: Divine Fury
radiant damage.description:
While raging, the first creature I hit with a weapon attack in my turn gets extra damage
   It takes an extra 1d6 + half my barbarian level worth of radiant damage

atkAdd: If I include the word 'Rage' in a melee weapon's name, it will show in its description that its first hit does extra damage.

subclassfeature3.1.name: Warrior of the Gods
subclassfeature3.1.description: Spells restoring me to life (not undeath or anything else) don't require material comp.

subclassfeature6.name: Fanatical Focus
subclassfeature6.description:
When I fail a saving throw while raging, I can reroll it and must use the new roll
   I can use this ability only once per rage

subclassfeature10.name: Zealous Presence
subclassfeature10.description:
As a bonus action, I choose up to 10 creatures within 60 ft that can hear my battle cry
   These creatures gain adv. on attacks and saves until the start of my next turn

subclassfeature14.name: Rage Beyond Death
subclassfeature14.description:
While raging, having 0 hit points doesn't knock me unconscious
   I still must make death saves, and I suffer the normal effects of taking damage
   I only die due to failed death saves if my rage ends while I'm at 0 HP

subclassfeature3.name: Dazzling Footwork

atkAdd: I can use either Strength or Dexterity and my Bardic Inspiration damage die in place of the normal damage die for any unarmed strike.

subclassfeature3.description:
While I'm not wearing armor or wielding a Shield, I gain the following benefits:
   Dance Virtuoso: I have Adv on Cha (Performance) checks I make that involve me dancing.
   Unarmored Defense: My base Armor Class is 10 + Dex mod + Cha mod.
   Agile Strikes: When I spend a BI as part of an action/Bonus Action/Reaction I can make an Unarmed Strike as part of it.
   Bardic Damage: My Unarmed Strikes can use Dex instead of Str. Unarmed Strike can deal Blud damage (BI die + Dex mod) instead of normal. This doesn't spend the die.

subclassfeature6.name: Inspiring Movement
subclassfeature6.description:
Spend one BI as a Reaction when an enemy I can see ends its turn within 5 ft of me to move up to half my Speed. An ally of my choice within 30 feet can also gain this benefit.
   None of this feature's movement provokes Opportunity Attacks.

subclassfeature6.1.name: Tandem Footwork
subclassfeature6.1.description: If I'm not Incapacitated when I roll Initiative I can roll one BI die. Each ally within 30 ft who can see or hear me adds the BI roll as a bonus to their Initative.

subclassfeature14.name: Leading Evasion
